TopicTitle: Reaction wheels applying constant torque without any input

Articles.Content:
KSP Version : 0.1.1.0

OS : Windows 11


Description :
Reaction wheels apply constant torque making the craft spin even with no input and SAS doesn't correct this roll even if enabled, only fix is to disable torque on the reaction wheel entierly.

Fixes : Pressing Alt+X puts the reaction wheel back to idle and solves the problem

 

 


 

Edited March 18, 2023 by Camisama
added fix
Have you tried pressing Alt+X to see if that fixes it? (If it does, it's a feature, not a bug.)
Thanks ! A lot !! Just out of curiosity, what is Alt+X supposed to be useful for ?

Alt+W/A/S/D/Q/E sets a "trim" along the chosen axis, meaning a constant small input on that axis. Pressing a key multiple times will increase the trim. Useful for a plane that wants to keep its nose up, for instance.

Alt+X cancels all trim and returns controls to neutral.
Ok thanks, so the problem was that the game transfered my trim from flying planes to my rockets and i didn't notice
